summary: Buckingham Palace in London is where the British king or queen lives and works. It's been the royal home since Queen Victoria moved in almost 200 years ago. The palace started as a big house built for a duke in 1703. Over time, it got bigger, with extra wings and a famous balcony where the royal family waves to crowds. It has 775 rooms and a huge garden. You can visit the beautiful state rooms when they're open to the public. The palace has seen important moments in history, like national celebrations and times of sadness.
title: Buckingham Palace
